comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Christian K. Ellingsen (or Ellingson) of Hawkins, Wisconsin Christian K. Ellingson, b. 1856; Jolster, Norway - d. 1921, married. Emma M. Evenson from Iola, Portage County, Wisconsin (according to genforum.genealogy.com/norway/messages/7428.html) "Christian K Ellingsen 12 June 1886 he married Emma Mathilde Evensen (born 23 December 1866 in Iola, Waupaca Co.) in Wausau, Marathon Co., Wis, and they got two children born there: C.K. was for ten years foreman at the Parchers & Stewart sawmill in Scandinavia. In 1890 he and his brother Sam accompanied by nephew C.P. bought a sawmill in Stetsonville, Wis. In 1902 they bought a large area near Hawkins, Wisconsin, and they founded a Jølster congregation there. C.K. was a bankier and landowner and told friends in Norway he could save 40 000 dollars in a good year. " (from digitalarkivet.uib.no/utstilling/eng/utvfam.htm) See also "A letter from one successful emigrant to another" by C.K. Ellingsen (digitalarkivet.uib.no/utstilling/eng/ckelling.htm). The photos of Ellingsen's letter are in digitalarkivet.uib.no/utstilling/eng/ckfoto.htm, the Ellingsen of one of the photos is certainly the same man as in the Bain photo. According to the Oshkosh Daily Northwestern, March 26,1916 he was nominated as delegate to the National Republican Convention, together with Emil Baensch (www.newspapers.com/newspage/16505163/) See also La Crosse Tribune Wednesday, April 05, 1916, page 6, col. 6 "PHILIPP PROBABUY WINS MAJORITY G.O.P. DELEGATES" Emil Baensch:

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: B-59: Thanks for all the research and for finding the link to Mr. Baensch. We will expand this record to reflect more of these details.
